com.nequissimus.university.k1584.data

Class TwoKeyMap<K1,K2,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      • java.util.HashMap<K1,java.util.Map<K2,V>>
        • com.nequissimus.university.k1584.data.TwoKeyMap<K1,K2,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    K1 - Key 1 type
    K2 - Key 2 type
    V - Value type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Map<K1,java.util.Map<K2,V>>

    public class TwoKeyMap<K1,K2,V>
extends java.util.HashMap<K1,java.util.Map<K2,V>>
    A Map implementation with two keys (technically a HashMap<K1, Map<K2, V>>) that provides some methods for working more comfortably.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • put

        public final V put(K1 key1,
    K2 key2,
    V value)
        Adds a value for the keys key1 and key2 to the map.

        Algorithm:
        Find the value map for key1.
        If no value map exists, create one.
        Add the pair (key2, value) to that value map.
        Add the value map to the original map.
        Parameters:
        key1 - First key
        key2 - Second key
        value - Value
        Returns:
        Value that was stored previously, NULL if none was stored.

      • get

        public final V get(K1 key1,
    K2 key2)
        Get a value for the keys key1 and key2.
        Parameters:
        key1 - First key
        key2 - Second key
        Returns:
        Returns the value for the keys, NULL if there is no entry.

      • remove

        public final V remove(K1 key1,
       K2 key2)
        Remove a value from the map for the given keys.
        Also, remove the secondary internal map if empty. Otherwise, the isEmpty method would no longer work correctly.
        Parameters:
        key1 - First key
        key2 - Second key
        Returns:
        The value if there was one, NULL otherwise.
